meanings.definition: To surpass in guile or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox outfoxes the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She always outfoxes her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to outfox the wise old owl.
meanings.sent4: The detective outfoxes the criminals with his sharp mind.
meanings.sent5: The tricky magician outfoxes the audience with his illusions.

meanings.sent1: The sly cat outfoxes the dog in the game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outfox the tricky riddle and solve it in no time.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse tried to outfox the sneaky cat by hiding in a tiny hole.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking outfoxes any challenges that come her way.
meanings.sent5: The cunning plan outfoxes the security guards and allows the thieves to escape.
